column2:
Si3N4 with Y2O3 & CeO2 
sintering aids. Al2O3
column4:
20 wt% whisker content. Powder route. Al2O3 hot pressed @ 1850°C & Si3N4 @ 
1725°C.

column2:
Si3N4 with Y2O3 & La2O3 
sintering aids.
column3:
Japanese Government Industrial 
Research Institute. Ref. [52-42]
column4:
Hot pressing @ 1800°C. Up to 50% whisker content. Whiskers modified strength 
of monolithic ceramic by very small amount to 650 MPa, fracture toughness 
improved slightly.

column2:
Si3N4 with Y2O3 & Al2O3 
sintering aids.
column3:
Swedish Institute for Silicate 
Research. Ref. [52-43], [52-44]
column4:
Cold isostatically pressed. Nitrided @ 1350°C and then Pressureless Sintered @ 
1850°C. Neither the flexural strength or the fracture toughness of Si3N4  
improved. The whisker:matrix bond judged to be too good, causing brittle failure.

column3:
Los Alamos National Laboratory, 
USA. Ref. [52-45]
column4:
Whisker volume fractions of 40%. Hot pressing @ 1850°C. Toughness increased by 
50% to 10.5 MPa m-1/2.

column2:
Si3N4 with Y2O3 & Al2O3 
sintering aids.
column4:
Hot pressed @ 1800°C. For 30 vol.% whiskers, fracture toughness increased by 
40% to 6.4 MPa m-1/2 & flexural strength by 25% to 950 MPa.

Hot pressed @ 1850°C for alumina matrix. Fracture toughness of both matrices 
improved two-fold. Al2O3 with 20 vol.% whiskers, flexural strength of 805 MPa @ 
RT & 520 MPa @1200°C obtained.

30 vol.% whiskers. Hot pressed to 1950°C. Flexural strength of 650 MPa; 
Fracture toughness 9.5 MPa m-1/2.

15 wt.% whiskers. Hot pressed to 1500°C. Flexural strength of 650 MPa; Fracture 
toughness 4.6 MPa m-1/2.

column3:
University of Southern 
California, USA. Ref. [52-52]
column4:
15 wt.% whiskers. Composite supplied by ARCO. Creep data acquired in air @ 
1500°C, where creep is appreciable even at stresses of 48 MPa.

Fracture Toughness & Fatigue Crack Growth study. 60% increase in toughness, 
K1C values increase by 70 to 150%.

Up to 40 wt.% whiskers. Hot pressed @ 1700°C. Flexural strength: 386 MPa; 
Fracture Toughness 3.52 MPa m-1/2. Failure strain: <0.15%.

column3:
University of Hamburg/Max-
Plank Institute, G.              
Ref. [52-55], [52-56]
column4:
Hot pressing of various matrix:whisker combinations. Thermal expansion 
mismatch between whiskers & matrix strongly influence strength levels. 
Fracture Toughness of all ceramics increased.

column3:
Los Alamos National Laboratory, 
USA. Ref. [52-57], [52-58]
column4:
20 vol.% whiskers. Hot pressed @ 1640°C. 100% increase in flexural strength; 
50% increase in Fracture Toughness.
